title: Johnson Faces G.O.P. Resistance to Quick Final Vote on Trump Policy Bill
summary: Several conservative House Republicans expressed grave reservations about changes the Senate made to the party’s major policy bill, leaving its fate and the timing of any final vote uncertain.

title: Planned Parenthood Must Choose Between Abortion or Millions in Federal Funding
summary: The nation’s largest abortion provider must stop offering it in some states or risk losing millions in Medicaid funding to provide basic health care for low-income Americans.

title: Trump’s Finances Were Shaky. Then He Began to Capitalize on His Comeback.
summary: Contrary to the president’s assertions, records filed in a fraud case against him suggest that his riches were not the product of a steady and strong empire.

title: Former Criminology Student Admits Killing 4 Idaho Students
summary: Bryan Kohberger pleaded guilty to the 2022 murders that shook the University of Idaho campus. Under a plea agreement, he avoids the death penalty.

title: Inside the Surprise Idaho Murders Plea Deal That Left Some Families Fuming
summary: After two and a half years of legal wrangling, prosecutors and lawyers for the defendant, Bryan Kohberger, reached a deal just weeks before his trial was set to begin.

title: The Serial Killer Expert Who Taught Bryan Kohberger
summary: Dr. Katherine Ramsland was Bryan Kohberger’s professor before he moved to the Pacific Northwest, where he is expected to plead guilty to killing four University of Idaho students.

title: Justice Dept. Weighs Seeking Criminal Charges as It Presses States for Election Data
summary: Such a path could drastically raise the stakes for federal investigations of state or county officials, bringing the department and the threat of criminalization into the election system.

title: Top F.D.A. Official Overrode Scientists on Covid Shots
summary: Records show that a top U.S. regulator rejected the recommendations of agency experts and limited the use of Covid vaccines.

title: Israel Wants to Resume Truce Talks With Hamas Soon
summary: Gideon Saar, the Israeli foreign minister, cited “positive signs” in the long-moribund cease-fire talks to end the war in Gaza and free the hostages held there.

title: Will the Bombing Stop Iran From Going Nuclear?
summary: Iran just ended its cooperation with international inspectors, suggesting no post-bombing deal is imminent. That may point to a long game of hide-and-seek, punctuated by military action.

title: He’s Ringo. And Nobody Else Is.
summary: As he turns 85, one of the last surviving Beatles is still musically curious, dispensing his signature wisdom, and preaching the gospel of peace and love.

title: Wisconsin Supreme Court Strikes Down 1849 Abortion Ban
summary: After the U.S. Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade in 2022, Republican prosecutors in Wisconsin said they intended to enforce the old law.

title: Pause in U.S. Weapons Deepens Ukrainian Concerns as Russian Attacks Grow
summary: The suspension includes air defense interceptors, and it will directly affect Ukraine’s ability to fend off escalating Russian air assaults.

title: Kim Jong-un Appears to Mourn His Troops Killed Fighting for Russia
summary: Through an event shown on North Korean state television, Mr. Kim also highlighted the sacrifices made for Moscow and the rewards he seeks.

title: Russia-Azerbaijan Tensions Soar, Threatening Moscow’s Influence
summary: The rift, provoked by the deaths of two ethnic Azerbaijanis in Russian custody, was the latest in a series of spats that revealed a deeper diplomatic rift between the former allies.

title: Trump Says U.S. Has Reached Trade Deal With Vietnam
summary: The president said he had agreed to initial trade terms with Vietnam, the second country to strike a limited deal after Mr. Trump threatened steep tariffs.

title: How U.S.-Japan Tariff Talks Got Stuck on Cars and Rice
summary: Negotiations have stalled ahead of next week’s deadline, with some suggesting Japan misjudged the depth of President Trump’s frustration over Tokyo’s policies.

title: The First Income Tax in the Persian Gulf Signals a Changing Economic Reality
summary: A plan by Oman is being closely watched by other governments in the region that are preparing for a future beyond oil.

title: Grand Theft A.T.M.: A Bodega Crime Wave Hits New York
summary: Common tools and a little muscle have fueled a crime wave that may have netted one burglary crew hundreds of thousands of dollars in a matter of months.

title: L.A. Legal Groups Sue to Stop ‘Unconstitutional’ Immigration Actions
summary: A suit filed in Los Angeles highlights Trump administration enforcement tactics and accuses officers of racial profiling, brutality and holding detainees in “dungeonlike” facilities.

title: What the Supreme Court’s Birthright Ruling Means for Trump’s Power
summary: A recent Supreme Court ruling could allow President Trump’s order ending birthright citizenship to go into effect in some states. Abbie VanSickle, a reporter covering the United States Supreme Court for The New York Times, explains how the decision also upends the power of federal judges to freeze policies for the entire country.

title: How Immigration Could Muddy the Jobs Numbers
summary: Job growth is expected to fall this year, adding to pressure on the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates. But the slowdown might reflect a smaller labor force, not declining demand from employers.

title: As Heat Grips Europe, a Struggle to Keep Workers and Customers Cool
summary: Companies are reporting a drop in business, reflecting the economic toll of the heat wave, which is lowering productivity and keeping shoppers at bay.

title: What to Know About the Heat Wave in Europe
summary: Weather agencies have warned of a third day of high temperatures that in some places have climbed well above 100 degrees Fahrenheit, or more than 40 degrees Celsius.

title: Squashing Spotted Lanternflies Will Get Us Only So Far. We Need Wasps.
summary: Is it wise to use one organism to combat another invasive one?

title: What I Heard on a Suicide Hotline for Trans Kids
summary: What the Trump administration fails to understand is that callers are desperately searching for just one trusted adult.

title: The Senate and the Supreme Court
summary: President Trump’s agenda passed in the Senate. It now goes to the House. Plus, we take a close look at this Supreme Court term.

title: Microsoft to Lay Off About 9,000 Employees
summary: The reductions followed cuts of about 6,000 positions last quarter, and were indicative of a tightening job market at big technology companies.

title: Tesla Sales Fall as Elon Musk Focuses on Self-Driving Cars
summary: The company has devoted resources to autonomous driving rather than developing new models to attract car buyers.

title: A Potential Mamdani Mayorship Strikes Fear in the Real Estate Industry
summary: The Democratic nominee has called for freezing the rent on a million apartments.
